Retail industry challenges due to e-commerce growth and declining foot traffic
Pandemic impact causing temporary closures and delayed projects
controversies: Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing in 2020 and subsequent restructuring
Scrutiny over environmental impact and sustainability practices

sources.title: CBL & Associates Properties, Inc. Emerged from Bankruptcy
sources.snippet: CBL & Associates Properties, Inc., emerged from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy as its plan of reorganization became effective on November 1, 2021. sources.title: US Bankruptcy Court Approves CBL Properties' Plan of Reorganization
sources.snippet: On Nov. 1, 2020, CBL filed petitions in for voluntary relief under Chapter 11 of Title 11 of the United States Bankruptcy Code. CBL received support for the plan, with more than 95% of votes cast for all classes in favor of the plan's confirmation. The effective date of the plan is expected to be Nov. 1.

sources.title: CBL Properties - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: CBL Properties headquarters in Chattanooga, Tennessee. CBL Properties (previously CBL & Associates, Inc., then CBL & Associates Properties, Inc.) is an American real estate investment trust that invests in shopping centers and owns shopping malls, primarily in the Southeastern and Midwestern United States.The company is organized in Delaware with its headquarters in Chattanooga, Tennessee.
